{%trans%} Clawpack (“Conservation Laws Package”) is a collection of finite volume methods for linear and nonlinear hyperbolic systems of conservation laws. Clawpack employs high-resolution Godunov-type methods with limiters in a general framework applicable to many kinds of waves. {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} Originally developed in 1994 by Randall LeVeque, Clawpack is now contributed to by many developers and includes a number of related projects. Key features include: {%endtrans%}

  • {%trans%}Solution of general hyperbolic PDEs provided a Riemann solver is given {%endtrans%}
  • Adaptive mesh refinement included in {%trans%}AMRClaw{%endtrans%} and GeoClaw
  • {%trans%}Parallelism scalable to tens of thousands of cores or more, included in PyClaw {%endtrans%}

{%trans%} Solution of a given PDE system with Clawpack relies on an approximate Riemann solver for that system. Solvers for many common applications are available in the Riemann package. {%endtrans%}
